text: Pours black, off white head very boozey aroma and flavor a nice scotch ale,
Screw-top can.  Bourbon and caramel malt aroma.  Brown with moderate head.  Sweet bourbon and caramel malt flavor.   Nicely blended.   Very tasty.

Pours black with a small off white head. Big oak scents, light peat and good wven malts. Taste is on par with the aroma. Great flavors of caramel and oakthat meld nicely. Overall this is super drinkable for an oak aged beer. So smooth love it.

On cask at Hay Merchant. Pours a very dark brown with medium creamy off white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is raisin oak and caramel. Medium mouthfeel with a strong oak flavor and light smokey finish. Alcohol present but not overpowering. A very good variation of the original.

On tap at the Winter Warmer 2012, this pours murky mahogany with a nice bubbly tan head that leaves light lacing. The nose is woody and of deep malts. The smooth, subtly soft palate contains very woody-oaked caramel and roasted grain flavors. A hint of whiskey finishes the pull, and with its complexities, what an awesome pull it is. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Poured dark brown color with an average frothy brown head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate roasted malt, vanilla wood and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with sticky texture and flat carbonation. Heavy roasted sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.
Draft to snifter at Dutchs. Looks good; amberish-brown with light beige lacing. Smells good too; sweet and oaky. Tastes like it smells with a nice mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

On tap. Keg label has "OAKED" sticker slapped over it. Keg cap has "AWO Med + Oaked Chub 9/6 Ready 9/18" written on it. Im assuming this is the version Im rating (if anyone has any info otherwise please PM me). Dark brown color, light brown / tan head, good lace. Nice oaky nose. Very tasty vanilla and caramel malt flavor. Bigger body, smooth carbonation. Kind of creamy texture. Dry finish. Long oaky vanilla and scotch aftertaste. Light alcohol. Great beer.

Cask at PPD. Clear deep ruby with weak bubbles. Typical incorrect cask tapping from Pizzeria Paradiso. Nose is richer maple, smoke, black cherry liquor. Taste is still rich despite zero carbonation. Sharper red wine barrel tannins are a surprise. No whiskey flavor. 8/3/8/4/16=3.9

On tap at The Common Table for the oskar blues beer dinner. Pours a deep amber/almost black with a thin tan head.  The aromas are vanilla, oak, smoke.  The mouthfeel is sticky, sweet and has a heavy body and good carbonation.  Good beer!  Cheers!

Dark brown color, small tiny beige head. Nose has vanilla. Some wood and roasted notes. Medium-bodied. Sweet flavor, lots of vanilla, bourbon, plums, perhaps some smoke with toasted flavors. Nice oak aged brew.
Strong barlywine-esque aroma with walnut and vanilla notes on the aroma.  Murky brown in color.  Really nice malt strength with those walnut/vanilla notes and charred tones.

at az wine 2/21/12.

looks  the same. the aroma and flavor are akin to chewing on a raw stave.... mixed with old chub. at times it throws out notes of bourbon, cinnamon, vanilla and toffee. oddly, lots of bourbon present though there is none here...only raw oak... weird. delicious in small amounts. 8/4/7/3/16

This one was full of barrel and at times it was really hard to find any Old Club in this one.  Woody and Boozy.  Which is totally fine with me because if you know me, I love that kind of stuff.   In the end I really liked it but would of loved to been able to taste some of the Old Chub.
On tap @ the brewery.  Pours a deep coffee brown with a small beige head.  Nose was full of roasted malts and dry oak.  Very smooth on the palate with a hint of oak.
On draft at the Fresh Craft.  Great cola color creamy head.  Malty oaky nose; sweet.  Currants, whisky sweetness.  Great carbonation throughout.

On tap at the Holy Grail Pub.

The beer pours a dark reddish-amber color with a white head. The aroma is excellent. I get a lot of chocolate with some peat notes. I also get some toffee and maple notes which compliment the other aromas very well. The flavor is also very nice. The main flavor is a chocolate and toffee malt mixture. I also get some vanilla, peat smoke and maple notes from the oak aging. The alcohol is detectable and the beer is very easy to drink. Medium, creamy mouthfeel and light carbonation. An outstanding beer.

On tap. Pours a deep brown with red hues and a tan head. Aroma of malt, light oak, toffee, caramel, spicy. Flavor much the same with a bit of heat and strong oak presence. Medium-heavy body with low carbonation.....great stuff!

On tap at Hops and Pies poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of oak, carmel, toffee and light vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of oak, carmel, toffee, light fruittiness and light vanilla with a smooth lingering carmel oak finish.
